message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.CR, cs.AI. 

The paper deals with the design of efficient sensing and resource allocation schemes for cognitive radios, which are devices that can dynamically adapt their transmission parameters based on the available spectrum. This topic is closely related to several sub-fields of computer science, including information theory (cs.IT), networking and internet architecture (cs.NI), systems and control (cs.SY), cryptography and security (cs.CR), and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). However, given the focus on optimization and dynamic programming techniques, as well as the use of performance metrics such as weighted sum rate and interference probability, it is most likely that the paper belongs to the cs.IT and cs.NI categories.
